meanings.definition: The practice of excluding or restricting others, especially in a discriminatory manner.
meanings.sent1: Her exclusivisms in the club made others feel unwelcome.
meanings.sent2: The exclusivisms of the country club kept many from joining.
meanings.sent3: His exclusivisms about who could sit at his lunch table were quite strict.
meanings.sent4: The exclusivisms of the VIP section made it seem like a forbidden paradise.
meanings.sent5: The exclusivisms of the elite group were like a high wall, keeping others out.

meanings.definition: The belief in the superiority or uniqueness of a particular group or ideology.
meanings.sent1: Their exclusivisms led them to think they were better than everyone else.
meanings.sent2: The exclusivisms of the cult made its members feel special.
meanings.sent3: The exclusivisms of the exclusive club were taken to a whole new level.
meanings.sent4: Her exclusivisms were like a shield, protecting her from differing opinions.
meanings.sent5: The exclusivisms of the team created a strong bond among its members.
